definition: to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: In a word, hard work and practice come.
A few months later, he worked hard on a small blackboard chalk, and finally succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 几个月后，他用一块小黑板苦练粉笔字，终于成功。

sentences.english: Everybody, from soldiers to cadres, should undergo such training.
sentences.chinese: 从战士到干部都要苦练。

sentences.english: He trained very hard, and he outdid all the competitors.
sentences.chinese: 他勤学苦练，结果超过了所有的对手。

sentences.english: By much pains , the orator overcame a natural impediment in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 这位演说家用苦练的方法克服了天生的口吃毛病。

sentences.english: One must have studied hard before one could succeed in mastering a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 一个人必须勤学苦练，才能精通一种外国语。

sentences.english: Tiger King the night of training, must swear to kill a black bear.
sentences.chinese: 虎王日夜苦练，发誓一定要把黑熊致于死地。

sentences.english: Doing some thing sedulously is a course understanding and practice hard.
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神地做某件事是项经过一番了解与苦练的。

sentences.english: After a hard practice we'd have to get on these exercise bikes around the court.
sentences.chinese: 一通苦练后，我们还得在场边练自行车健身器。

sentences.english: Heng Jing put his whole heart into study and practice.
sentences.chinese: 恒景全心全意地学习和苦练。

sentences.english: Gold refines in the fire and man in trouble.
Lee three practice martial arts, hand blade black gold.
sentences.chinese: 李三苦练武功，手刃黑金。

sentences.english: Fuller clock drilling, and finally out of a training extraordinary boy.
sentences.chinese: 恒景废寝忘食苦练，终于练出了一身非凡的武艺。

sentences.english: Dick loved basketball and practiced hard until he was put on the first string.
sentences.chinese: 迪克爱好篮球，勤学苦练，终于被选为。

definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
(of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
